subject: Politics
title: The Arctic Frontier
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Arctic Frontier.

hook.text: Ice is melting. Shipping lanes are opening. Russia, Canada, and the US are racing to claim the Arctic.

buildup.text: The Arctic holds vast oil, gas, and mineral reserves. Climate change is making them accessible for the first time.

discovery.text: Russia planted a flag on the Arctic seabed in 2007. It's building military bases and icebreakers at a rapid pace.

twist.text: The Northern Sea Route could cut shipping times from Asia to Europe by 40%. Control of it is a strategic prize.

climax.text: Eight Arctic nations cooperate through the Arctic Council. But rising tensions and military moves threaten that peace.

punchline.text: The Arctic was too frozen to fight over. Now it's thawing â€” and so is the peace.

quiz.question: Why is the Arctic becoming a geopolitical hotspot?
options: Melting ice is revealing resources and opening new shipping routes
Arctic nations have recently gone to war
The Arctic has always been heavily contested
